info.title: Koshee Protect
info.summary: API for interacting with Koshee Protect servers
info.description:
Provides an API for interacting with Koshee Protect servers

## Features

* Read output of detect and interact with results of models on cameras over different date runs
* Read output of track manager and interact with results of track ids
* Upload base tracks to use in track manager runs
* Upload videos to use in detect runs
* Request model runs against single images
* Modify detect and track configurations
* Run detect and track configurations

post.description:
**Logs into the system**

Creates an access token if username and password are authenticated.

- **form_data**: the user request form.

post.description:
**Overrides current user preferences with approved changes**. Note that not all
  user preferences can be overridden. To see a list of preferences that are likely
  to be allowed, call this method with a GET to see a filtered list of preferences.
  These preferences can affect Protect's detect and track manager processes, as
  well as the GUI functionality. It is recommended that interoperable and
  accessibility settings such as font sizes are kept consistent for users of
  external applications. Consequently, it is very likely that font sizes should
  be consistent in preferences as applied to the Protect GUI as well as external
  web or other applications.

parameters.name: preferences_contents

schema.description: overrides for existing preferences file, json in string format
schema.title: Preferences Contents

parameters.description: overrides for existing preferences file, json in string format

get.description:
**Gets anomalies from a start index to a max number of anomalies**

  May return a zip of just the manifest if the results.json file has no
  valid anomalies within the indexing range and available to user
  Args:
    config_name: the replay config
    camera_name: the replay camera name
    date_folder: the replay date
    anomaly_index_start: the index (0..n) to start grabbing frames from
    start_time: start time, if not using index (can be None for any start time)
    end_time: end time, if not using index (can be None for any end time)
    max_frames: the maximum frames to grab (up to 100)
    include_originals: include original images when anomalies appear
    version: an API version to use, if different than current

get.description:
**Gets regularities from a start frame index to a maximum of max frames and
  returns a zip and manifest of any files within the range** Note that this
  is modeled to be similar to keyframes and anomalies, but regularities can
  include frames that are original frames only and do not have any crops.
  This function only returns the index.json file and any associated frames
  that have a regularity, keyframe, and anomaly crop. With the index, you
  can get any frame ids necessary for the originals function frame id list. 

  May return a zip of just the manifest if the range has no valid frames
  and available to user
  Args:
    config_name: the replay config
    camera_name: the replay camera name
    date_folder: the replay date
    frame_index_start: the index (0..n) to start grabbing frames from
    start_time: start time, if not using index (can be None for any start time)
    end_time: end time, if not using index (can be None for any end time)
    max_frames: the maximum frames to grab (up to 100)
    include_originals: include original images when regularities appear
    version: an API version to use, if different than current

parameters.name: config_name

schema.description: The config dir name in replay dir
schema.title: Config Name

parameters.description: The config dir name in replay dir

parameters.name: camera_name
